pr_title: [Service Bus] Prepare tracing methods for message processor and scheduleMessage

timeline.message: Remove usage of environment variable AZURE_SERVICE_BUS_CONNECTION_STRING
Prepare tracing for MessageProcessor, schedule and other APIs

Revert "Remove usage of environment variable AZURE_SERVICE_BUS_CONNECTION_STRING"

This reverts commit 0ce8d23a

timeline.bodyText: Should this also include the queue name, topic name etc?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: So EntityPath can be either queue or topic.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: Where is this method called from?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: This is prepared for message processor.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

timeline.bodyText: Same here. Where is this method called from? I guess this was added for the processor only but I think the async receiver should use them since the message processor is just a wrapper around the async receiver's receive method.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
We probably do same  what .Net have done for their processor.. If we just have to do tracing for each receive message, we can do in async receiver. But if there is addition tracing for processor, which .Net is doing, we should also do.
FYI-> for receive and processor would both would be kind.Consumer ? @samvaity
replies.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: Discussed with Srikanta. We only need to processor for GA and waiting for .Net to confirm with service team about tracing and then possibly add tracing to the receiver after GA. The minimum requirement is to have parity with EventHub, which has tracing for processor but not for consumer client.
replies.author: YijunXieMS

replies.bodyText: @hemanttanwar Following what we have for eventhubs, processor spans should be consumer spans.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Starts a new process tracing span and attaches the returned context to the EventData object for users.
          
          
            
                 * Starts a new process tracing span and attaches the returned context to the ServiceBusReceivedMessage object for users.
timeline.author: srnagar
hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText:
ProcessKind.MESSAGE should be used to create a message. Just like in EventHubs. 
  
    
      azure-sdk-for-java/sdk/eventhubs/azure-messaging-eventhubs/src/main/java/com/azure/messaging/eventhubs/EventDataBatch.java
    
    
         Line 158
      in
      914ab8b
    
    
    
    

        
          
           Context eventSpanContext = tracerProvider.startSpan(AZ_TRACING_SERVICE_NAME, eventContext,
replies.author: YijunXieMS

replies.bodyText: The ProcessKind helps the tracer apply specific attributes on the span. For example, in the case of MESSAGE, the tracer will attribute the spanType=Producer, here
replies.author: samvaity
YijunXieMS

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I think we initially had this as RECEIVE and later updated to MESSAGE so the left over javadoc. But yes it should be updated to suit process kind "message". AMQP process kind for message spans.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: Need to add javadoc for this.
timeline.author: samvaity
